examples: She trained seven hours a day to prepare for the Olympics.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To teach and form (someone) by practice; to educate (someone).
examples: You can't train a pig to write poetry.
I trained with weights all winter.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To move (a gun ) laterally so that it points in a different direction .
examples: The assassin had trained his gun on the minister.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , horticulture ) To encourage (a plant or branch ) to grow in a particular direction or shape , usually by pruning and bending .
examples: The vine had been trained over the pergola .

definitions.definition: ( transitive , machine learning ) To feed data into an algorithm , usually based on a neural network , to create a machine learning model that can perform some task.
( transitive , mining ) To trace (a lode or any mineral appearance) to its head .
( transitive , video games ) To create a trainer ( cheat patch ) for; to apply cheats to (a game).
( transitive , obsolete ) To draw (something) along; to trail, to drag (something).
( intransitive , obsolete , of clothing ) To trail down or along the ground .

secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To teach and form (someone) by practice; to educate (someone).
( transitive ) To move (a gun ) laterally so that it points in a different direction .
( transitive , horticulture ) To encourage (a plant or branch ) to grow in a particular direction or shape , usually by pruning and bending .
( transitive , machine learning ) To feed data into an algorithm , usually based on a neural network , to create a machine learning model that can perform some task.
( transitive , mining ) To trace (a lode or any mineral appearance) to its head .
( transitive , video games ) To create a trainer ( cheat patch ) for; to apply cheats to (a game).
( transitive , obsolete ) To draw (something) along; to trail, to drag (something).
( intransitive , obsolete , of clothing ) To trail down or along the ground .

definitions.definition: To draw by persuasion, artifice, or the like; to attract by stratagem; to entice; to allure.
To be on intimate terms with.

main_definition: ( transitive , obsolete ) To draw by persuasion, artifice, or the like; to attract by stratagem; to entice; to allure.
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete , colloquial ) To be on intimate terms with.
